title: Authors and Citation
text: Yongshi Deng. Author, maintainer. Thomas Lumley. Thesis advisor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Deng Y (2026). miae: Multiple Imputation Autoencoders. R package version 0.0.1.
code: @Manual{,   title = {miae: Multiple Imputation Through Autoencoders},   author = {Yongshi Deng},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.0.1}, }

title: Multiple Imputation Through Autoencoders
text: miae R package multiple imputation autoencoders built Torch.

title: Multiple Imputation Through Autoencoders
text: can install current development version miae GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") #devtools::install_github("agnesdeng/miae") # To load the newborn dataset from the R package mixgb library(mixgb) # To obtain visualization diagnostics plot library(vismi) # Multiple imputation through autoencoder library(miae) #>  #> Attaching package: 'miae' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:mixgb': #>  #>     createNA, impute_new

what: 2. Multiple imputation with denoising autoencoder with dropout
title: Multiple Imputation Through Autoencoders
code: # load the newborn dataset from the R package mixgb data("newborn") str(newborn) #> tibble [2,107 × 16] (S3: tbl_df/tbl/data.frame) #>  $ household_size                : int [1:2107] 4 3 5 4 4 3 5 3 3 3 ... #>  $ age_months                    : int [1:2107] 2 5 10 10 8 3 10 7 2 7 ... #>  $ sex                           : Factor w/ 2 levels "Male","Female": 2 1 2 2 1 1 2 2 2 1 ... #>  $ race                          : Factor w/ 3 levels "White","Black",..: 1 1 2 1 1 1 2 1 2 2 ... #>  $ ethnicity                     : Factor w/ 3 levels "Mexican-American",..: 3 1 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 ... #>  $ race_ethinicity               : Factor w/ 4 levels "Non-Hispanic White",..: 1 3 2 1 1 1 2 1 2 2 ... #>  $ head_circumference_cm         : num [1:2107] 39.3 45.4 43.9 45.8 44.9 42.2 45.8 NA 40.2 44.5 ... #>  $ recumbent_length_cm           : num [1:2107] 59.5 69.2 69.8 73.8 69 61.7 74.8 NA 64.5 70.2 ... #>  $ first_subscapular_skinfold_mm : num [1:2107] 8.2 13 6 8 8.2 9.4 5.2 NA 7 5.9 ... #>  $ second_subscapular_skinfold_mm: num [1:2107] 8 13 5.6 10 7.8 8.4 5.2 NA 7 5.4 ... #>  $ first_triceps_skinfold_mm     : num [1:2107] 9 15.6 7 16.4 9.8 9.6 5.8 NA 11 6.8 ... #>  $ second_triceps_skinfold_mm    : num [1:2107] 9.4 14 8.2 12 8.8 8.2 6.6 NA 10.9 7.6 ... #>  $ weight_kg                     : num [1:2107] 6.35 9.45 7.15 10.7 9.35 7.15 8.35 NA 7.35 8.65 ... #>  $ poverty_income_ratio          : num [1:2107] 3.186 1.269 0.416 2.063 1.464 ... #>  $ smoke                         : Factor w/ 2 levels "Yes","No": 2 2 1 1 1 2 2 1 2 1 ... #>  $ health                        : Ord.factor w/ 5 levels "Excellent"<"Very Good"<..: 1 3 1 1 1 1 1 1 2 1 ... colSums(is.na(newborn)) #>                 household_size                     age_months  #>                              0                              0  #>                            sex                           race  #>                              0                              0  #>                      ethnicity                race_ethinicity  #>                              0                              0  #>          head_circumference_cm            recumbent_length_cm  #>                            124                            114  #>  first_subscapular_skinfold_mm second_subscapular_skinfold_mm  #>                            161                            169  #>      first_triceps_skinfold_mm     second_triceps_skinfold_mm  #>                            124                            167  #>                      weight_kg           poverty_income_ratio  #>                            117                            192  #>                          smoke                         health  #>                              7                              0 # use default setting midae_imp <- midae(data = newborn, m = 5, save.model = TRUE,     path = file.path(tempdir(), "midaemodel.pt")) # use customized setting params <- list(input.dropout = 0.1, hidden.dropout = 0.3, optimizer = "adamW",     learning.rate = 1e-04, encoder.structure = c(128, 64, 32),     decoder.structure = c(32, 64, 128), scaler = "robust", act = "elu",     init.weight = "he.normal.elu.dropout")  midae_imp <- midae(data = newborn, m = 5, categorical.encoding = "onehot",     device = "cpu", epochs = 10, batch.size = 32, subsample = 1,     early.stopping.epochs = 1, dae.params = params, pmm.type = NULL,     save.model = FALSE, path = file.path(tempdir(), "midaemodel.pt")) #> [1] "cpu" #> [1] "Running midae()." #> Loss at epoch 1: 12.488301 #> Loss at epoch 2: 11.565661 #> Loss at epoch 3: 10.562836 #> Loss at epoch 4: 9.626559 #> Loss at epoch 5: 9.068845 #> Loss at epoch 6: 8.649516 #> Loss at epoch 7: 8.380188 #> Loss at epoch 8: 8.107727 #> Loss at epoch 9: 7.987867 #> Loss at epoch 10: 7.818303 # obtain the fifth imputed dataset midae_imp[[5]] vismi(data = newborn, imp_list = midae_imp, x = "recumbent_length_cm",     y = "head_circumference_cm")

title: Multiple Imputation Through Autoencoders
code: # use default setting mivae.default <- mivae(data = newborn, m = 5, save.model = TRUE,     path = file.path(tempdir(), "mivaemodel.pt")) # use customized setting params <- list(beta = 0.95, optimizer = "adamW", learning.rate = 1e-04,     encoder.structure = c(128, 64, 32), decoder.structure = c(32,         64, 128), scaler = "robust", act = "elu", init.weight = "he.normal.elu")  mivae_imp <- mivae(data = newborn, m = 5, categorical.encoding = "onehot",     device = "cpu", epochs = 10, batch.size = 32, subsample = 1,     vae.params = params, pmm.type = NULL, save.model = FALSE,     path = file.path(tempdir(), "mivaemodel.pt")) #> [1] "cpu" #> [1] "Running mivae()." #> Loss at epoch 1: 35.675899 #> Loss at epoch 2: 19.422141 #> Loss at epoch 3: 15.617250 #> Loss at epoch 4: 13.763628 #> Loss at epoch 5: 12.954665 #> Loss at epoch 6: 12.400232 #> Loss at epoch 7: 11.831417 #> Loss at epoch 8: 11.551251 #> Loss at epoch 9: 11.273910 #> Loss at epoch 10: 11.021976 vismi(data = newborn, imp_list = mivae_imp, x = "recumbent_length_cm",     y = "head_circumference_cm")

what: 4. Impute new data using a saved imputation model
title: Multiple Imputation Through Autoencoders
code: set.seed(2026) n <- nrow(newborn) idx <- sample(1:n, size = round(0.7 * n), replace = FALSE) train_data <- newborn[idx, ] test_data <- newborn[-idx, ] mivae_obj <- mivae(data = train_data, m = 5, categorical.encoding = "onehot",     device = "cpu", epochs = 10, batch.size = 32, vae.params = params,     pmm.type = NULL, save.model = TRUE, path = file.path(tempdir(),         "mivaemodel.pt")) #> [1] "cpu" #> [1] "Running mivae()." #> Loss at epoch 1: 29.979715 #> Loss at epoch 2: 19.491138 #> Loss at epoch 3: 16.139240 #> Loss at epoch 4: 14.509602 #> Loss at epoch 5: 13.449686 #> Loss at epoch 6: 12.711522 #> Loss at epoch 7: 12.258354 #> Loss at epoch 8: 11.747288 #> Loss at epoch 9: 11.562428 #> Loss at epoch 10: 11.292023 #> [1] "The VAE multiple imputation model is saved in  /var/folders/wz/s9x7fy7d2wsgmcf5kfcv040h0000gn/T//RtmpyzQzyL/mivaemodel.pt" mivae_imp_new <- impute_new(object = mivae_obj, newdata = test_data,     m = 5)

what: Create missing values for a dataset — createNA
title: Create missing values for a dataset — createNA
text: function creates missing values missing complete random mechanism (MCAR). demonstration purposes .

title: Create missing values for a dataset — createNA
Create missing values for a dataset — createNA
text: data complete data frame. var.names var.names variables missing values generated. p proportion missing values data frame proportions missing values corresponding variables specified var.names.

title: Create missing values for a dataset — createNA
text: data frame artificial missing values

title: Create missing values for a dataset — createNA
code: # Create 30% MCAR data across all variables in a dataset withNA.df <- createNA(data = iris, p = 0.3)  # Create 30% MCAR data in a specified variable in a dataset withNA.df <- createNA(data = iris, var.names = c("Sepal.Length"), p = 0.3)  # Create MCAR data in several specified variables in a dataset withNA.df <- createNA(data = iris,   var.names = c("Sepal.Length", "Petal.Width", "Species"),   p = c(0.3, 0.2, 0.1) )

title: Auxiliary function for dae.params — dae_default
text: Auxiliary function setting default dae-related hyperparameters midae.

title: Auxiliary function for dae.params — dae_default
code: dae_default(   shuffle = TRUE,   drop.last = FALSE,   input.dropout = 0.2,   hidden.dropout = 0.5,   optimizer = "adamW",   learning.rate = 0.001,   weight.decay = 0.01,   momentum = 0,   dampening = 0,   eps = 1e-08,   rho = 0.9,   alpha = 0.99,   learning.rate.decay = 0,   encoder.structure = c(256, 128, 64),   latent.dim = 8,   decoder.structure = c(64, 128, 256),   act = "elu",   init.weight = "he.normal.elu.dropout",   scaler = "standard",   initial.imp = "sample",   lower = 0.25,   upper = 0.75 )

title: Auxiliary function for dae.params — dae_default
text: shuffle Whether shuffle training data. Default: TRUE. drop.last Whether drop last batch. Default: FALSE. input.dropout dropout probability input layer. Default: 0.2. hidden.dropout dropout probability hidden layers. Default: 0.5. optimizer name optimizer. Options : "adamW" (default), "adam", "adadelta", "adagrad", "rmsprop", "sgd". learning.rate learning rate. Default: 0.001. weight.decay Weight decay (L2 penalty). Default: 0.01. momentum Parameter "sgd" optimizer (default: 0). used accelerating SGD relevant direction dampens oscillations. dampening Dampening momentum (default: 0) used "sgd" optimizer. eps small positive value (default: 1e-08) used prevent division zero optimizers "adamW", "adam", "adadelta","adagrad" "rmsprop". rho Parameter "adadelta" optimizer (default: 0.9). coefficient used computing running average squared gradients. alpha Smoothing constant (default: 0.99) "rmsprop" optimizer. learning.rate.decay Learning rate decay (default: 0) "adagrad" optimizer. encoder.structure vector indicating structure encoder. Default: c(256, 128, 64) latent.dim Size latent layer. Default: 8. decoder.structure vector indicating structure decoder. Default: c(64, 128, 256) act name activation function. Can : "relu", "elu" (default), "leaky.relu", "tanh", "sigmoid" "identity". init.weight distribution weight initialization. Can ".normal", ".uniform", "xavier.uniform", "xavier.normal", ".normal.dropout", ".normal.elu", ".normal.elu.dropout" (default), ".normal.selu" ".normal.leaky.relu". scaler name scaler used transforming numeric features. Can "standard" (default), "minmax" , "decile", "robust" "none". initial.imp method initial imputation. Can "mean", "median" "sample" (default). lower lower quantile (0.25 default) scaler = "robust". upper upper quantile (0.75 default) scaler = "robust".

what: Auxiliary function for pmm.params for midae — dae_pmm_default
title: Auxiliary function for pmm.params for midae — dae_pmm_default
text: Auxiliary function setting default pmm-related parameters midae

title: Auxiliary function for pmm.params for midae — dae_pmm_default
code: dae_pmm_default(   pmm.type = NULL,   pmm.k = 5,   pmm.link = "prob",   pmm.save.vars = NULL )

title: Auxiliary function for pmm.params for midae — dae_pmm_default
text: pmm.type type predictive mean matching (PMM). Possible values: NULL: Imputations without PMM; 0: Imputations PMM type 0; 1: Imputations PMM type 1; 2: Imputations PMM type 2; "auto" (default): Imputations PMM type 2 numeric/integer variables; imputations without PMM categorical variables. pmm.k number donors predictive mean matching. Default: 5 pmm.link link predictive mean matching binary variables "prob" (default): use probabilities; "logit": use logit values. pmm.save.vars names variables whose predicted values observed entries saved. use PMM.

title: Data cleaning — data_clean

title: Data cleaning — data_clean
code: data(nhanes3) rawdata <- nhanes3  rawdata[4, 4] <- NaN rawdata[5, 5] <- Inf rawdata[6, 6] <- -Inf  cleandata <- data_clean(rawdata = rawdata) #> Warning: There exists at least one entry coded as NaN in the following numeric variable(s): head_circumference_cm. #> It is now coverted to NA instead. #> Warning: There exists at least one entry coded as Inf or -Inf in the following variable(s): recumbent_length_cm;weight_kg. #> It is now coverted to NA instead.

what: Multiple imputation through denoising autoencoders with dropout — midae

text: function used generate multiply-imputed datasets using denoising autoencoders Monte-Carlo dropout, early stopping predictive mean matching (PMM).

title: Multiple imputation through denoising autoencoders with dropout — midae
code: midae(   data,   m = 5,   categorical.encoding = "onehot",   device = "cpu",   epochs = 100,   batch.size = 512,   subsample = 1,   early.stopping.epochs = 1,   dae.params = list(),   pmm.type = NULL,   pmm.k = 5,   pmm.link = "prob",   pmm.save.vars = NULL,   loss.na.scale = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE,   print.every.n = 1,   save.model = FALSE,   path = NULL )

title: Multiple imputation through denoising autoencoders with dropout — midae
text: data data.frame, tibble data.table missing values. m number imputed datasets. Default: 5. categorical.encoding method representing multi-class categorical features. Can either "embeddings" "onehot" (default). device Device use. Either "cpu" (default) "cuda" GPU. epochs number training epochs (iterations). Default: 100. batch.size size samples batch. Default: 512. subsample subsample ratio training data. Default: 1. early.stopping.epochs integer value k. training midae stop validation performance improved k epochs, used subsample less 1. Default: 1. dae.params list parameters denoising autoencoders. See documentation function dae_default() details. pmm.type type predictive mean matching (PMM). Possible values: NULL (default): Imputations without PMM; 0: Imputations PMM type 0; 1: Imputations PMM type 1; 2: Imputations PMM type 2; "auto": Imputations PMM type 2 numeric/integer variables; imputations without PMM categorical variables. pmm.k number donors predictive mean matching. Default: 5 pmm.link link predictive mean matching binary variables: "prob" (default): use probabilities; "logit": use logit values. pmm.save.vars names variables whose predicted values observed entries saved. use PMM. loss.na.scale Whether multiply ratio missing values  feature calculate loss function. Default: FALSE. verbose Whether print training loss information. Default: TRUE. print.every.n verbose set TRUE, print training loss every n epochs. Default: 1. save.model Whether save imputation model. Default: FALSE. path path final imputation model saved.

title: Multiple imputation through denoising autoencoders with dropout — midae
code: withNA.df <- createNA(data = iris, p = 0.2) imputed.data <- midae(   data = withNA.df, m = 5, epochs = 5, batch.size = 32,   path = file.path(tempdir(), "midaemodel.pt") ) #> [1] "cpu" #> [1] "Running midae()." #> Loss at epoch 1: 7.553148 #> Loss at epoch 2: 7.253237 #> Loss at epoch 3: 5.984915 #> Loss at epoch 4: 5.772735 #> Loss at epoch 5: 4.866691

code: mivae(   data,   m = 5,   categorical.encoding = "onehot",   device = "cpu",   epochs = 100,   batch.size = 512,   subsample = 1,   early.stopping.epochs = 1,   vae.params = list(),   pmm.type = NULL,   pmm.k = 5,   pmm.link = "prob",   pmm.save.vars = NULL,   loss.na.scale = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE,   print.every.n = 1,   save.model = FALSE,   path = NULL )

title: multiple imputation through variational autoencoders — mivae
text: data data.frame, tibble data.table missing values. m number imputed datasets. Default: 5. categorical.encoding method representing multi-class categorical features. Can either "embeddings" "onehot" (default). device Device use. Either "cpu" (default) "cuda" GPU. epochs number training epochs (iterations). Default: 100. batch.size size samples batch. Default: 512. subsample subsample ratio training data. Default: 1. early.stopping.epochs integer value k. training mivae stop validation performance improved k epochs, used subsample less 1. Default: 1. vae.params list parameters variational autoencoders. See documentation function vae_default() details. pmm.type type predictive mean matching (PMM). Possible values: NULL (default): Imputations without PMM; 0: Imputations PMM type 0; 1: Imputations PMM type 1; 2: Imputations PMM type 2; "auto": Imputations PMM type 2 numeric/integer variables; imputations without PMM categorical variables. pmm.k number donors predictive mean matching. Default: 5 pmm.link link predictive mean matching binary variables: "prob" (default): use probabilities; "logit": use logit values. pmm.save.vars names variables whose predicted values observed entries saved. use PMM. loss.na.scale Whether multiply ratio missing values  feature calculate loss function. Default: FALSE. verbose Whether print training loss information. Default: TRUE. print.every.n verbose set TRUE, print training loss every n epochs. Default: 1. save.model Whether save imputation model. Default: FALSE. path path final imputation model saved.

title: multiple imputation through variational autoencoders — mivae
code: withNA.df <- createNA(data = iris, p = 0.2) imputed.data <- mivae(   data = withNA.df, m = 5, epochs = 5, batch.size = 32,   path = file.path(tempdir(), "mivaemodel.pt") ) #> [1] "cpu" #> [1] "Running mivae()." #> Loss at epoch 1: 12.616460 #> Loss at epoch 2: 7.908068 #> Loss at epoch 3: 6.215472 #> Loss at epoch 4: 5.204566 #> Loss at epoch 5: 5.066845

title: NHANES III (1988-1994) newborn data — newborn
text: dataset extracted NHANES III (1988-1994) age class Newborn (1 year). Please note example dataset contains selected variables demonstration purposes .

title: NHANES III (1988-1994) newborn data — newborn
NHANES III (1988-1994) newborn data — newborn
text: data frame 2107 rows 16 variables, adapted NHANES III dataset. Nine variables contain missing values. Variable names factor levels renamed clarity easier interpretation. household_size Household size. integer variable ranging 1 10. original variable name NHANES III dataset HSHSIZER. age_months Age interview (screener), months. integer variable ranging 2 11. original variable name NHANES III dataset HSAGEIR. sex Sex subject. factor variable levels Male Female. original variable name NHANES III dataset HSSEX. race Race subject. factor variable levels White, Black, . original variable name NHANES III dataset DMARACER. ethnicity Ethnicity subject. factor variable levels Mexican-American, Hispanic, Hispanic. original variable name NHANES III dataset DMAETHNR. race_ethinicity Combined race–ethnicity classification. factor variable levels Non-Hispanic White, Non-Hispanic Black, Mexican-American, . original variable name NHANES III dataset DMARETHN. head_circumference_cm Head circumference, centimetres. Numeric. original variable name NHANES III dataset BMPHEAD. recumbent_length_cm Recumbent length, centimetres. Numeric. original variable name NHANES III dataset BMPRECUM. first_subscapular_skinfold_mm First subscapular skinfold thickness, millimetres. Numeric. original variable name NHANES III dataset BMPSB1. second_subscapular_skinfold_mm Second subscapular skinfold thickness, millimetres. Numeric. original variable name NHANES III dataset BMPSB2. first_triceps_skinfold_mm First triceps skinfold thickness, millimetres. Numeric. original variable name NHANES III dataset BMPTR1. second_triceps_skinfold_mm Second triceps skinfold thickness, millimetres. Numeric. original variable name NHANES III dataset BMPTR2. weight_kg Body weight, kilograms. Numeric. original variable name NHANES III dataset BMPWT. poverty_income_ratio Poverty income ratio. Numeric. original variable name NHANES III dataset DMPPIR. smoke Whether anyone living household smokes cigarettes inside home. factor variable levels Yes . original variable name NHANES III dataset HFF1. health General health status subject. ordered factor levels Excellent, Good, Good, Fair, Poor. original variable name NHANES III dataset HYD1.

what: Tune dropout rate for midae — tune_dropout_midae
title: Tune dropout rate for midae — tune_dropout_midae
text: Tune dropout rate midae

title: Tune dropout rate for midae — tune_dropout_midae
code: tune_dropout_midae(   data,   dropout.grid = list(input.dropout = c(0, 0.25, 0.5), hidden.dropout = c(0, 0.25, 0.5)),   m = 5,   categorical.encoding = "embeddings",   device = "cpu",   epochs = 5,   batch.size = 32,   subsample = 1,   early.stopping.epochs = 1,   dae.params = list(),   pmm.type = NULL,   pmm.k = 5,   pmm.link = "prob",   pmm.save.vars = NULL,   loss.na.scale = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE,   print.every.n = 1,   save.model = FALSE,   path = NULL )

title: Tune dropout rate for midae — tune_dropout_midae
text: data dataset midae model trained. dropout.grid list containing two vectors: input.dropout hidden.dropout, specifying dropout rates tested input layer hidden layers, respectively. m number imputations perform. categorical.encoding method used encoding categorical variables. Defaults "embeddings". device computing device use, either "cpu" "cuda" GPU. epochs number training epochs model. batch.size size batches used training. subsample proportion data used training. Defaults 1, meaning full dataset used. early.stopping.epochs number epochs improvement training stopped. dae.params list parameters denoising autoencoder. loss.na.scale Boolean flag indicating whether scale loss function based NA values. Defaults FALSE. verbose Boolean flag control verbosity function's output. print.every.n Specifies often (epochs) print training progress. relevant verbose TRUE. save.model Boolean flag indicating whether save trained model. path File path model saved save.model TRUE. NULL save.model TRUE, model saved current directory. pmm.params list parameters predictive mean matching.

title: Tune dropout rate for midae — tune_dropout_midae
text: list containing tuned parameters corresponding performance metrics.

title: Tune dropout rate for midae — tune_dropout_midae
Auxiliary function for vae.params — vae_default
text: Auxiliary function setting default vae-related hyperparameters mivae.

title: Auxiliary function for vae.params — vae_default
code: vae_default(   shuffle = TRUE,   drop.last = FALSE,   beta = 1,   input.dropout = 0,   hidden.dropout = 0,   optimizer = "adamW",   learning.rate = 0.001,   weight.decay = 0.01,   momentum = 0,   dampening = 0,   eps = 1e-08,   rho = 0.9,   alpha = 0.99,   learning.rate.decay = 0,   encoder.structure = c(256, 128, 64),   latent.dim = 8,   decoder.structure = c(64, 128, 256),   act = "elu",   init.weight = "he.normal.elu",   scaler = "standard",   initial.imp = "sample",   lower = 0.25,   upper = 0.75 )

title: Auxiliary function for vae.params — vae_default
text: shuffle Whether shuffle training data. Default: TRUE. drop.last Whether drop last batch. Default: FALSE. beta regularized parameter. Default: 1. input.dropout dropout probability input layer. Default: 0. hidden.dropout dropout probability hidden layers. Default: 0. optimizer name optimizer. Options : "adamW" (default), "adam", "adadelta", "adagrad", "rmsprop", "sgd". learning.rate learning rate. Default: 0.001. weight.decay Weight decay (L2 penalty). Default: 0.01. momentum Parameter "sgd" optimizer (default: 0). used accelerating SGD relevant direction dampens oscillations. dampening Dampening momentum (default: 0) used "sgd" optimizer. eps small positive value (default: 1e-08) used prevent division zero optimizers "adamW", "adam", "adadelta","adagrad" "rmsprop". rho Parameter "adadelta" optimizer (default: 0.9). coefficient used computing running average squared gradients. alpha Smoothing constant (default: 0.99) "rmsprop" optimizer. learning.rate.decay Learning rate decay (default: 0) "adagrad" optimizer. encoder.structure vector indicating structure encoder. Default: c(256, 128, 64) latent.dim Size latent layer. Default: 8. decoder.structure vector indicating structure decoder. Default: c(64, 128, 256) act name activation function. Can : "relu", "elu" (default), "leaky.relu", "tanh", "sigmoid" "identity". init.weight distribution weight initialization. Can ".normal", ".uniform", "xavier.uniform", "xavier.normal", ".normal.dropout", ".normal.elu" (default), ".normal.elu.dropout", ".normal.selu" ".normal.leaky.relu". scaler name scaler used transforming numeric features. Can "standard" (default), "minmax" , "decile", "robust" "none". initial.imp method initial imputation. Can "mean", "median" "sample" (default). lower lower quantile (0.25 default) scaler = "robust". upper upper quantile (0.75 default) scaler = "robust".
